Detailed Description

Line compounds a list of flows references.

Lines is concept that comes from the way humans work. In seismic processing, flows tends to be grouped by some categorying reason or because some team work on it. Another reason for grouping flow into lines is to separate the work each computer/cluster will do.

As flows are kept saved as files, line references them with their path. Therefore, a line is a list of flows files. When a flow needs to be read or edited you ask the line for its path (see geoxml_line_get_flow_source) and then load it with geoxml_document_load. New flows can be added to a line using geoxml_line_append_flow.

Define Documentation

#define GEOXML_LINE ( doc   )     ((GeoXmlLine*)(doc))

Cast line's document doc to GeoXmlLine.

#define GEOXML_LINE_FLOW ( seq   )     ((GeoXmlLineFlow*)(seq))

Promote a sequence to a line flow.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct geoxml_line GeoXmlLine

Line class.

Inherits GeoXmlDocument.

The GeoXmlLine struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

typedef struct geoxml_line_flow GeoXmlLineFlow

Represents a reference to a flow inside a line.

It contains the path of the line.

The GeoXmlLineFlow struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

typedef struct geoxml_line_path GeoXmlLinePath

The GeoXmlLinePath struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

Function Documentation

GeoXmlLine* geoxml_line_new (  ) 

Create a new empty line and return a pointer to it.

Returns NULL if memory couldn't be allocated.

GeoXmlLineFlow* geoxml_line_append_flow ( GeoXmlLine *  line,
const gchar *  source 
)

Create a new flow and append it to list of flows references.

If line or source is NULL returns NULL

int geoxml_line_get_flow ( GeoXmlLine *  line,
GeoXmlSequence **  line_flow,
gulong  index 
)

Writes to line_flow the index ieth flow reference that line belong.

If an error ocurred, the content of line_flow is assigned to NULL.

If line is NULL nothing is done.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_INDEX, GEOXML_RETV_NULL_PTR

See also:
geoxml_sequence_move geoxml_sequence_move_up geoxml_sequence_move_down geoxml_sequence_remove

glong geoxml_line_get_flows_number ( GeoXmlLine *  line  ) 

Get the number of flows that line has.

If line is NULL returns -1.

void geoxml_line_set_flow_source ( GeoXmlLineFlow *  line_flow,
const gchar *  source 
)

Set the location of line_flow to source.

If line_flow is NULL nothing is done.

const gchar* geoxml_line_get_flow_source ( GeoXmlLineFlow *  line_flow  ) 

Returns the location of the flow reference line_flow.

If line_flow is NULL returns NULL.

GeoXmlLinePath* geoxml_line_append_path ( GeoXmlLine *  line,
const gchar *  path 
)

Creates a new path and append it to the list of path.

See also:
geoxml_line_new_path

int geoxml_line_get_path ( GeoXmlLine *  line,
GeoXmlSequence **  path,
gulong  index 
)

Writes to path the index ieth path that belongs to line.

If an error ocurred, the content of path is assigned to NULL.

Returns one of: GEOXML_RETV_SUCCESS, GEOXML_RETV_INVALID_INDEX, GEOXML_RETV_NULL_PTR

See also:
geoxml_sequence_move geoxml_sequence_move_up geoxml_sequence_move_down geoxml_sequence_remove

Get the number of path that line has.

If line is NULL returns -1.
